citation.article-title: Treponema socranskii sp. nov., Treponema socranskii subsp. socranskii subsp. nov. Treponema socranskii subsp. buccale subsp. nov., and Treponema socranskii subsp. paredis subsp. nov. isolated from human periodontia

p.s: Description of Treponema socranskii subsp. paredis subsp. nov.
Treponema socranskii subsp. paredis (pa.re'dis. Gr. n. pares cheek; N.L. gen. n. paredis of a cheek)
Treponemes in homology group K are designated Treponema socranskii subsp. paredis.
Phenotypic characteristics of this subspecies are shown in Table 3.
Arabinose and rhamnose are not fermented.
Other characteristics of this subspecies are the same as those of the species.
The type strain of T. socranskii subsp. paredis is strain ATCC 35535 (= VPI D46CPE1), which was isolated from a supragingival sample from a patient with severe periodontal disease.

T. socranskii subsp. paredis can be easily separated from T. socranskii subsp. socranskii and T. socranskii subsp. buccale by the inability of T. socranskii subsp. paredis to ferment L-arabinose and rhamnose (Table 3).
